title: How to Make Buttermilk Pancakes

steps.headline: Grab your bowl and mix all of the "dry" ingredients together (sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and flour).
Start mixing the "wet" ingredients in the "dry" bowl (buttermilk, vanilla extract, eggs (optional), and butter).
steps.description: Continue when it's only combined; ignore any lumps for right now.

steps.headline: Turn on the stove top/range to medium heat and place a frying pan on the range.
steps.description: Pour a bit of oil into the pan.

steps.headline: Take a ladle and scoop a good proportion of pancake batter.
steps.description: Pour it in the frying pan and cook it for either 3 minutes or when you see bubbles forming at the top of the pancake.

steps.headline: Take your spatula and carefully try to flip the pancake over.
steps.description: After flipping, cook this side for about a minute. Wait until the pancake turns a golden brown color and put it on a plate.

steps.headline: Do the cooking steps for the other pancake pieces.
Serve with maple syrup and your choice of fruit, for example strawberries.
